intro: Fraxinus insularis, commonly known as the island ash, is a deciduous tree native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a slender, often multi-trunked form. The leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate with serrated margins, turning yellow in autumn. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers appear in catkins and are followed by winged fruits. The tree is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and island environments.
